qas.question: How many people does the de Jong Concert Hall seat?

answers.text: one of BYU's first drama teachers

qas.question: What type of theater is Nelke Theatre primarily used for?
What is named after T. Earl and Gerrit de Jong Jr.?
What theater has a proscenium opening of 19m?
What theater was named for Kathryn N. Margetts?
What is named after Kathryn de Jong Jr.?

context: The campus also houses several performing arts facilities. <b8_0>The de Jong Concert Hall<b8_0/> seats <a0_0>1282<a0_0/> people and is named for Gerrit de Jong Jr. <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>The Pardoe Theatre<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> is named for T. Earl and Kathryn Pardoe. Students use its stage in a variety of theatre experiments, as well as for Pardoe Series performances. It seats 500 people, and has quite a large stage with a proscenium opening of 19 by 55 feet (17 m). <a2_0><b7_0>The Margetts Theatre<b7_0/><a2_0/> was named for Philip N. Margetts, a prominent Utah theatre figure. A smaller, black box theater, it allows a variety of seating and staging formats. It seats 125, and measures 30 by 50 feet (15 m). The Nelke Theatre, named for <a3_0>one of BYU's first drama teachers<a3_0/>, is used largely for instruction in <a4_0>experimental<a4_0/> theater. It seats 280.
